channel.title: Monitor suggestions.
channel.description: I was looking to buy a new monitor, since the one I'm using needs to be replaced. Do you guys know of anything that really gets a good bang for your buck?

item.title: Monitor suggestions.
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
How many bucks are you looking to spend?

I’ve got an ASUS ROG Swift PG278Q. It’s 1440p, 144hz, G-Sync, low response time. And TN panel, but I like that, because I tried IPS and was thoroughly unimpressed with it.

It was also about $700 when I bought it.

Read full topic

item.title: Monitor suggestions.
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
Which monitor are you replacing?

Depending on the quality you are used to from the old monitor, if you are buying cheap you might end up disaspointed.
For me, i am using the AOC F22+. Cheap 1080p, 60 FPS monitor with no special features (or hdmi input, but it is old though).

However, 7+ years in the running on settings:
Contrast: 50/100
Brightness: 80/100

Still running perfectly with no dead pixels or other faults.

Cons: The monitor isn’t placed on a stand, rather it’s designed to always be at an angle.
Bit annoying, but not that bad.

I don’t remember what i paid for it.

Conclusion:

Just buy any 1080p 60fps monitor from a respectable brand.

Read full topic
